value.title: Azure Active Directory and Power BI
value.excerpt: I take a look at how Power BI and Azure Active Directory interact.  Really it is more about Azure Active Directory and how do you get users into AAD.  This came up as I get pinged a lot from folks wondering how they can use AAD with Power BI, not necessarily realizing that it is already there.  http://blogs.technet.com/b/powerbisupport/archive/2015/09/15/azure-active-directory-and-power-bi.aspx

value.title: Column Profiling in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Adam walks through column profiling within the Power BI Desktop. This includes the latest updates with the general availability (GA) within the April 2019 Power BI Desktop release.  Demo files: https://guyinacu.be/demofiles  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube -- http://twitter.com/awsaxton

value.title: Copy Conditional Columns in Power Query or Power BI
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at how to use conditional columns within Power Query and then copying them for use in other queries or Power BI Desktop files. This is a great technique if you don't want to retype all of the conditional items in the dialog in Power BI.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com

images.title: Copy Conditional Columns in Power Query or Power BI

value.title: Create Power BI reports in Power BI Report Server
value.excerpt: Create Power BI reports in Power BI Report Server  In this video, I walk through the steps to create your Power BI Report in order to publish it to Power BI Report Server. This involves downloading and installing Power BI Desktop optimized for Power BI Report Server and connecting to Analysis Services

value.title: Handling deletes within Incremental Refresh in Power BI
value.excerpt: Are you using Incremental Refresh in Power BI? Are you stuck with how to handle deletes? Patrick has a great technique you can use to not only handle deletes, but also more easily handle updates with your partitions.  Download sample: https://guyinacu.be/handledeletessample  游닉 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership

value.title: How the Power BI Data Region is selected
value.excerpt: In this video, I look at how the Power BI data region is selected. This is the what you see when you go to About Power BI and see "Your data is stored in". You should take care to make sure this is where the majority of users you are before anyone signs up for Office 365, Power BI or other Microsoft

value.title: Inside Power Query reference queries for Power BI and Excel
value.excerpt: Chris Webb joins Patrick to look at what happens when you use reference queries for Power Query. This applies to both Power BI and Excel. Chris also looks at how change the behavior to make things a bit faster.  Data Privacy Blog: https://blog.crossjoin.co.uk/2018/12/27/data-privacy-settings-data-refresh-performance-power-bi-excel/

value.title: Mark as Date Table in Power BI Desktop is here!
value.excerpt: Mark as Date Table in Power BI Desktop is finally here! In this video, Patrick takes what Adam did with a custom date table and shows you how you can use Mark as Date Table in Power BI Desktop. This feature was introduced in the February 2018 release of Power BI Desktop. Mark as Date Table has been available

value.title: Measuring RLS Performance in Power BI
value.excerpt: Have you tried measuring performance of Row-Level Security (RLS) in Power BI? How much overhead does it have? That can be a challenge using the tools we talk about. Adam shows you how you can do it!  RLS Playlist: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLv2BtOtLblH1dBK34FqClo2eXXQgWW1ui  RLS Course: https://guyinacu.be/rlscourse

value.title: Power BI Auditing
value.excerpt: In this video, I look at the Power BI Auditing feature that was made available a few weeks ago. I show how to turn it on and how to search. This can be helpful with understanding who is doing what within your organization.  Offical Docs: https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/powerbi-admin-auditing/

value.title: Power BI Desktop And Role-Playing Dimensions: Can you do it?
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick talks about Power BI Desktop and role-playing dimensions. Can you even do this in Power BI Desktop? Patrick shows you why one particular way is not recommended as it will cause trouble. And then show you how you can use DAX within Power BI Desktop to take this to the next level.

value.title: Power BI URL Filter Updates (August 2018)
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at the recent updates to using the Power BI URL Filter. The update to using URL Filter parameters in Power BI include updates to operators along with the ability to use more than strings and spaces in table names!   Blog: https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/power-bi-report-url-filter-improvements/

value.title: Power BI User lookup with the gateway using Active Directory
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at how you can use Active Directory custom attributes for the user lookup with the Power BI Gateway. This can be used for both Analysis Services mapping and the Kerberos SSO with DirectQuery connections.  Manage your data source - Analysis Services https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/service-gateway-enterprise-manage-ssas#usernames-with-analysis-services

value.title: Setting default values using COALESCE in DAX
value.excerpt: Learn how to get default values using the DAX COALESCE function instead of IF statements. A great way to avoid BLANK in Power BI!  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/dax/coalesce-function-dax  SQLBI.com article:  https://sql.bi/659297   游닉 Become a member: https://guyinacu.be/membership   *******************
